intro: Clidemia radulifolia, commonly known as the whiteleaf false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Clidemia radulifolia is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
